refnamediv.refpurpose: a widget for displaying both trees and lists.

row.entry: If True grid lines should be drawn in the tree view
If True, the user can search through columns interactively. Default value: True
If True tree lines should be drawn in the tree view
If True, assume all rows have the same height thereby speeding up display. Default value: False. Available in GTK+ 2.4 and above.
The horizontal Adjustment for the widget
If True, the column headers respond to click events. Default value: False
If True, show the column header buttons. Default value: True

If True, rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them. This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in gtk.ComboBox or gtk.EntryCompletion. Default value: False. Available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.

If True, the selected row follows the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes gtk.SELECTION_SINGLE and gtk.SELECTION_BROWSE. This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in gtk.ComboBox or gtk.EntryCompletion. Default value: False. Available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The model for the tree view
If True, the view is reorderable. Default value: False.
If True enable selection of multiple items by dragging the mouse pointer
If True, hint to the theme engine to draw rows in alternating colors. Default value: False.
The model column to search when searching through code. Allowed values: >= -1. Default value: -1
The vertical Adjustment for the widget
If True, allow drawing of alternating color rows. Default value: True
The gtk.gdk.Color to use for even rows. Available in GTK+ 2.2 and above.
The size of the expander arrow. Allowed values: >= 0. Default value: 12
Dash pattern used to draw the tree view grid lines
Width, in pixels, of the tree view grid lines
The horizontal space between cells. Must be an even number. Allowed values: >= 0. Default value: 2
If True, the expanders are indented.
The gtk.gdk.Color to use for odd rows. Available in GTK+ 2.2 and above.
Dash pattern used to draw the tree view lines
Width, in pixels, of the tree view lines
The vertical space between cells. Must be an even number. Allowed values: >= 0. Default value: 2

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A gtk.TreeView widget is used to display the contents of any model implementing the gtk.TreeModel interface. The tree models provided standard with GTK+ and PyGTK are:
In addition, PyGTK provides gtk.GenericTreeModel that allows you to create your own tree model entirely in Python.

The gtk.TreeView uses columns and cell renderers to actually display the model information. GTK+ and PyGTK provides the gtk.TreeViewColumn to manage the display of a column and the following cell renderers:
In addition, PyGTK provides the gtk.GenericCellRenderer that allows you to create your own cell renderers entirely in Python.

refsect1.title: Constructor

listitem.simpara: the tree model to display
A new gtk.TreeView widget.

refsect1.para: Creates a new gtk.TreeView widget displaying the model specified by model.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_model

listitem.simpara: the current gtk.TreeModel, or None if none is currently being used.

refsect2.para: The get_model() method returns the value of the "model" property containing the model the gtk.TreeView is displaying or None there is no the model.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_model

listitem.simpara: the new tree model to use with the treeview

refsect2.para: The set_model() method sets the "model" property for the treeview to the value of model. If the treeview already has a model set, this method will remove it before setting the new model. If model is None, it will unset the old model.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_selection

listitem.simpara: A gtk.TreeSelection object.

refsect2.para: The get_selection() method returns the current gtk.TreeSelection associated with the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_hadjustment

listitem.simpara: a gtk.Adjustment object, or None if none is currently being used.

refsect2.para: The get_hadjustment() method returns the value of the "hadjustment" property that contains the current horizontal gtk.Adjustment object or None (if no horizontal adjustment is being used).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_hadjustment

listitem.simpara: the gtk.Adjustment to set

refsect2.para: The set_hadjustment() method sets the "hadjustment" property to the value of adjustment that must be a gtk.Adjustment object.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_vadjustment

listitem.simpara: a gtk.Adjustment object, or None if none is currently being used.

refsect2.para: The get_vadjustment() method returns the value of the "vadjustment" property that contains the horizontal gtk.Adjustment or None if there is no vertical adjustment.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_vadjustment

listitem.simpara: the gtk.Adjustment to set

refsect2.para: The set_vadjustment() method sets the "vadjustment" property to the value of adjustment. The new gtk.Adjustment replaces the current vertical adjustment.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_headers_visible

listitem.simpara: True if the headers are visible.

refsect2.para: The get_headers_visible() method returns the value of the "headers-visible" property. If "headers-visible" is True the headers on the treeview are visible.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_headers_visible

listitem.simpara: if True the headers are visible

refsect2.para: The set_headers_visible() method sets the "headers-visible" property to the value of headers_visible. If headers_visible is True the headers will be displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.columns_autosize
refsect2.para: The columns_autosize() method resizes all columns to their optimal width. Only works after the treeview has been realized.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_headers_clickable

listitem.simpara: if True the headers are clickable

refsect2.para: The set_headers_clickable() method sets the "headers-clickable" property to the value of active. If active is True the column title buttons can be clicked.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_rules_hint

listitem.simpara: if True the tree requires reading across rows

refsect2.para: The set_rules_hint() method sets the "rules-hint" property to the value of setting. If setting is True it indicates that the user interface for your application requires users to read across tree rows and associate cells with one another. By default, the tree will be rendered with alternating row colors. Do not use it just because you prefer the appearance of the ruled tree; that's a question for the theme. Some themes will draw tree rows in alternating colors even when rules are turned off, and users who prefer that appearance all the time can choose those themes. You should call this method only as a semantic hint to the theme engine that your tree makes alternating colors useful from a functional standpoint (since it has lots of columns, generally).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_rules_hint

listitem.simpara: True if rules are useful for the user of this tree

refsect2.para: The get_rules_hint() returns the value of the "rules-hint" property. See the set_rules_hint() method for more information on the use of "rules-hint".

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.append_column

listitem.simpara: the gtk.TreeViewColumn to add.
the number of columns in tree_view after appending.

refsect2.para: The append_column() method appends the specified column to the list of columns and returns the new number of columns in the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.remove_column

listitem.simpara: the gtk.TreeViewColumn to remove.
the number of columns in the treeview after the column removal.

refsect2.para: The remove_column() method removes the specified column from the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.insert_column

listitem.simpara: the gtk.TreeViewColumn to be inserted.
the position to insert column.
the number of columns in the treeview after the insertion.

refsect2.para: The insert_column() method inserts the specified column into the treeview at the location specified by position. If position is -1, then the column is inserted at the end.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.insert_column_with_attributes

listitem.simpara: the position to insert the new column in.
the title to set the header to.
the gtk.CellRenderer.
optional keyword-value arguments
the gtk.TreeViewColumn that was inserted.

refsect2.para: The insert_column_with_attributes() method creates a new gtk.TreeViewColumn and inserts it into the treeview at the location specified by position with the column title specified by title and using the gtk.CellRenderer specified by cell. If position is -1, then the newly created column is inserted at the end. The column is initialized with the optional attributes passed as keyword-value pairs (e.g. text=0, foreground=2). See the gtk.TreeViewColumn.add_attribute() method for more information.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.insert_column_with_data_func

listitem.simpara: the position to insert, -1 for append
the column title
a cell renderer for the column
the function or method to set attributes of the cell renderer
the data to pass with func
the number of columns in the treeview after the insertion

refsect2.para: The insert_column_with_data_func() method is a convenience function that inserts a new column into the treeview at the location specified by position with the specified title and the cell renderer specified by cell and using the function or method specified by func to set cell renderer attributes (normally using data from the model). The signature of func is:

where column is the gtk.TreeViewColumn in the treeview, cell is the gtk.CellRenderer for column, model is the gtk.TreeModel for the treeview and iter is the gtk.TreeIter pointing at the row. See the gtk.TreeViewColumn.set_cell_data_func() and gtk.TreeViewColumn.pack_start() methods for more detail.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_column

listitem.simpara: the position of the column, counting from 0.
the gtk.TreeViewColumn, or None if the position is outside the range of columns.

refsect2.para: The get_column() method returns the gtk.TreeViewColumn at the specified position in the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_columns

listitem.simpara: a list of gtk.TreeViewColumn s

refsect2.para: The get_columns() method returns a list of all the gtk.TreeViewColumn objects currently in the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.move_column_after

listitem.simpara: the gtk.TreeViewColumn to be moved.
the gtk.TreeViewColumn column is to be after, or None.

refsect2.para: The move_column_after() method moves the gtk.TreeViewColumn specified by column to be after the treeview column specified by base_column. If base_column is None, then column is placed in the first position.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_expander_column

listitem.simpara: the column to draw the expander arrow at orNone.

refsect2.para: The set_expander_column() method sets the "expander-column" property to the value of column which must be a gtk.TreeViewColumn in the treeview. If column is None, then the expander arrow is always at the first visible column.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_expander_column

listitem.simpara: the expander column.

refsect2.para: The get_expander_column() method returns the value of the "expander-column" property that contains the current expander column i.e. the column that has the expander arrow drawn next to it.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_column_drag_function

listitem.simpara: A function to determine which columns are reorderable, or None.
User data to be passed to func, or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.4 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_column_drag_function() method sets the user function specified by func for determining where a column may be dropped when dragged. The user function is called on every column pair in turn at the beginning of a column drag to determine where a drop can take place. The signature of func is:
refsect2.programlisting: def func(tree_view, column, prev_column, next_column, data)
refsect2.para: where tree_view is the gtk.TreeView, column is the gtk.TreeViewColumn being dragged, prev_column and next_column are the two gtk.TreeViewColumn objects bracketing the drop spot, and data is user_data. If prev_column or next_column is None, then the drop is at an edge. If func is None, the user drag function is removed and the gtk.TreeView reverts to the default behavior of allowing any reorderable column to be dropped anywhere.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.scroll_to_point

listitem.simpara: the X coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1
the Y coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1

refsect2.para: The scroll_to_point() method scrolls the treeview so that the top-left corner of the visible area is at the location specified by tree_x and tree_y, where tree_x and tree_y are specified in tree window coordinates. The treeview must be realized before this method is called. If it isn't, you should use the scroll_to_cell() method instead. If either tree_x or tree_y are -1, there is no scrolling in that direction.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.scroll_to_cell

listitem.simpara: the path of the row to move to
the gtk.TreeViewColumn to move horizontally to, or None.
if True use the alignment arguments
the vertical alignment of the row specified by path.
the horizontal alignment of the column specified by column.

refsect2.para: The scroll_to_cell() method scrolls the treeview display to the position specified by column and path. If column is None, no horizontal scrolling occurs. The alignment parameters specified by row_align and col_align determines where column is placed within the treeview. The values of col_align and row_align range from 0.0 to 1.0. The alignment values specify the fraction of display space that is to the left of or above the cell. If use_align is False, the alignment arguments are ignored, and the tree does the minimum amount of work to scroll the cell onto the screen. This means that the cell will be scrolled to the edge closest to it's current position. If the cell is currently visible on the screen, nothing is done. This method only works if the model is set, and path is a valid row in the model.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.row_activated

listitem.simpara: the tree path of the row of the cell to be activated.
the gtk.TreeViewColumn of the cell to be activated.

refsect2.para: The row_activated() method activates the cell determined by path and column.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.expand_all
refsect2.para: The expand_all() method recursively expands all nodes in the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.collapse_all
refsect2.para: The collapse_all() method recursively collapses all visible, expanded nodes in the treeview.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.expand_to_path

listitem.simpara: a path to a row.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.2 and above.

refsect2.para: The expand_to_row() method expands the row with the tree path specified by path. This will also expand all parent rows of path as necessary.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.expand_row

listitem.simpara: the path to a row
if True recursively expand, otherwise just expand immediate children

refsect2.para: The expand_row() method opens the row specified by path so its children are visible. If open_all is True all rows are expanded, otherwise only the immediate children of path are expanded.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.collapse_row

listitem.simpara: the path to a row

refsect2.para: The collapse_row() method collapses the row specified by path (hides its child rows, if they exist).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.map_expanded_rows

listitem.simpara: A function to be called
User data to be passed to the function.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.2 and above.

refsect2.para: The map_expanded_rows() method calls the function specified by func on all expanded rows passing data as an argument.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.row_expanded

listitem.simpara: the path to a row to test the expansion state.
True if path is expanded.

refsect2.para: The row_expanded() method returns True if the node pointed to by path is expanded.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_reorderable

listitem.simpara: if True, the tree can be reordered.

refsect2.para: The set_reorderable() method sets the "reorderable" property to the value of reorderable. This method is a convenience method to allow you to reorder models that support the gtk.TreeDragSource and the gtk.TreeDragDest interfaces. Both gtk.TreeStore and gtk.ListStore support these. If reorderable is True, then the user can reorder the model by dragging and dropping rows. The application can listen to these changes by connecting to the model's signals.

note.para: This function does not give you any degree of control over the order -- any reordering is allowed. If more control is needed, you should probably handle drag and drop manually.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_reorderable

listitem.simpara: True if the tree can be reordered.

refsect2.para: The get_reorderable() method returns the value of the "reorderable" property that determines if the user can reorder the tree via drag-and-drop. See the set_reorderable() method for more information.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_cursor

listitem.simpara: a tree path
a gtk.TreeViewColumn, or None
if True the specified cell should start being edited.

refsect2.para: The set_cursor() method sets the current keyboard focus to be at the row specified by path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If column is not None, then focus is given to the specified column. Additionally, if column is specified, and start_editing is True, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This method is often followed by the gtk.Widget.grab_focus() method to give keyboard focus to the treeview. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_cursor_on_cell

listitem.simpara: a tree path
a gtk.TreeViewColumn, or None
a gtk.CellRenderer, or None
True if the specified cell should start being edited.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.2 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_cursor_on_cell() method sets the current keyboard focus to be at the node specified by path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If focus_column is specified, focus is given to that column. If focus_column and focus_cell are specified, and focus_column contains 2 or more editable or activatable cells, then focus is given to the cell specified by focus_cell. Additionally, if focus_column is specified, and start_editing is True, editing should be started in the specified cell. This method is often followed by the gtk.Widget.grab_focus() method in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_cursor

listitem.simpara: a tuple containing the current cursor path and focus column.

refsect2.para: The get_cursor() method returns a tuple containing the current path and focus column. If the cursor isn't currently set, the current path will be None. If no column currently has focus, the current focus column will be None.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_bin_window

listitem.simpara: a gtk.gdk.Window, or None

refsect2.para: The get_bin_window() method returns the window that the treeview renders to or None if the treeview is not realized yet. This is used primarily to compare to the event.window attribute to confirm that the event on the treeview is on the right window.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_path_at_pos

listitem.simpara: The x position to be identified.
The y position to be identified.
a tuple containing: a tree path; a gtk.TreeViewColumn object; the X coordinate relative to the cell; and, the Y coordinate relative to the cell. If there is no path at the position None is returned.

refsect2.para: The get_path_at_pos() method returns a tuple containing:

listitem.simpara: the path at the specified point (x, y), relative to widget coordinates
the gtk.TreeViewColumn at that point
the X coordinate relative to the cell background
the Y coordinate relative to the cell background

refsect2.para: x and y are relative to the coordinates of an event on the treeview only when event.window==treeview.get_bin_window(). It is primarily used for popup menus. This method is only meaningful if the treeview is realized. This method returns None if there is no path at the position.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_cell_area

listitem.simpara: a tree path for the row
a gtk.TreeViewColumn for the column
rectangle

refsect2.para: The get_cell_area() method returns the bounding gtk.gdk.Rectangle in tree window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by path and the column specified by column. If path points to a path not currently displayed, the y and height attributes of the rectangle will be 0. The sum of all cell rects does not cover the entire tree; there are extra pixels in between rows, for example. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the cell_area passed to the gtk.CellRenderer.render() method. This method is only valid if the treeview is realized.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_background_area

listitem.simpara: a tree path for the row,
a gtk.TreeViewColumn for the column
a rectangle

refsect2.para: The get_background_area() method returns the bounding gtk.gdk.Rectangle in tree window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by path and the column specified by column. If path points to a node not found in the tree, the y and height attributes of the rectangle will be 0. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the background_area passed to the gtk.CellRenderer.render(). These background areas tile to cover the entire tree window (except for the area used for header buttons). Contrast with the cell_area, returned by the get_cell_area() method, that returns only the cell itself, excluding the surrounding borders and the tree expander area.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_visible_rect

listitem.simpara: a rectangle

refsect2.para: The get_visible_rect() method returns the bounding gtk.gdk.Rectangle for the currently visible region of the treeview widget, in tree coordinates. Convert to widget coordinates with the tree_to_widget_coords(). Tree coordinates start at 0,0 for row 0 of the tree, and cover the entire scrollable area of the tree.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.widget_to_tree_coords

listitem.simpara: the widget X coordinate
the widget Y coordinate
a tuple containing the tree X and Y coordinates

refsect2.para: The widget_to_tree_coords() method returns a tuple containing the tree X and Y coordinates for the widget coordinates specified by wx and wy. The tree coordinates cover the full scrollable area of the tree.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.tree_to_widget_coords

listitem.simpara: tree X coordinate
tree Y coordinate
a tuple containing the widget X and Y coordinates

refsect2.para: The tree_to_widget_coords() method returns a tuple containing the widget coordinates for the tree coordinates specified by tx and ty.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.enable_model_drag_source

listitem.simpara: the bitmask of buttons that can start the drag
a sequence of tuples containing target data
the possible actions for a drag

refsect2.para: The enable_model_drag_source() method sets the treeview to start a drag operation when the user click and drags on a row. The value of start_button_mask is a combination of the.

targets is a sequence (list or tuple) of tuples that contain information about the targets. The target data contains a string representing the drag type, target flags (a combination of the ) and an application assigned integer ID used for identification purposes.
The value of actions is one of the .

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.enable_model_drag_dest

listitem.simpara: a sequence of tuples containing target data
the possible actions for a drag

refsect2.para: The enable_model_drag_dest() method sets the treeview to receive a drag drop.

targets is a sequence (list or tuple) of tuples that contain information about the targets. The target data contains a string representing the drag type, target flags (a combination of gtk.TARGET_SAME_APP and gtk.TARGET_SAME_WIDGET or neither) and an application assigned integer ID used for identification purposes.
The value of actions is one of the .

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.unset_rows_drag_source
refsect2.para: The unset_rows_drag_source() method unsets the drag source information.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.unset_rows_drag_dest
refsect2.para: The unset_rows_drag_dest() method unsets the drag destination information.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_drag_dest_row

listitem.simpara: a tree path of the row to highlight, or None.
a drop position

refsect2.para: The set_drag_dest_row() method sets the treeview drag destination row to the value specified by path with the drop position specified by pos. The value of pos must be one of: gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_BEFORE, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_AFTER, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_BEFORE or gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_AFTER.
In PyGTK 2.10 and above, path may be None.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_drag_dest_row

listitem.simpara: a 2-tuple containing the tree path and the drop position relative to the tree path or None

refsect2.para: The get_drag_dest_row() method returns a 2-tuple containing the path of the drag destination row and a drop position relative to the destination row. The drop position is one of: gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_BEFORE, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_AFTER, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_BEFORE or gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_AFTER. This method returns None if no drag destination row is set.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_dest_row_at_pos

listitem.simpara: the x coordinate of the position
the y coordinate of the position
a 2-tuple containing the path of the row and the drop position at the position specified by x and y or None

refsect2.para: The get_dest_row_at_pos() method returns a 2-tuple containing the path of the row and the drop position relative to the row of the position specified by x and y. The drop position is one of: gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_BEFORE, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_AFTER, gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_BEFORE or gtk.TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_AFTER.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.create_row_drag_icon

listitem.simpara: a tree path
a new pixmap of the drag icon.

refsect2.para: The create_row_drag_icon() method creates a gtk.gdk.Pixmap representation of the row specified by path. This image is used for a drag icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_enable_search

listitem.simpara: if True, the user can search interactively

refsect2.para: The set_enable_search() method sets the "enable-search" property to the value of enable_search. If enable_search is True the user can type in text to search through the tree interactively.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_enable_search

listitem.simpara: True if the user can search interactively

refsect2.para: The get_enable_search() method returns the value of the "enable-search" property. If "enable-search" is True the tree allows interactive searching.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_search_column

listitem.simpara: the column the interactive search code searches.

refsect2.para: The get_search_column() method returns the value of the "search-column" property that is the column searched by the interactive search code.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_search_column

listitem.simpara: the column to search

refsect2.para: The set_search_column() method sets the "search-column" property to the value of column. The value of column is the column where the interactive search code should search. Additionally, this method turns on interactive searching (see the set_enable_search() method).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_search_equal_func

listitem.simpara: the compare function to use during the search or None
user data to pass to func, or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.4 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_search_equal_func() method sets the compare function for the interactive search capabilities to the function specified by func. If user_data is specified and not None, it is passed to func. If func is None, the default gtk.TreeView search equal function will be used. The signature of func is:
refsect2.programlisting: def func(model, column, key, iter, data)
refsect2.para: where model is the gtk.TreeModel of the gtk.TreeView, column is the number of the column being searched (see the set_search_column() method for more information), key is the string being searched for, iter is a gtk.TreeIter pointing to the current candidate row and data is the context data user_data. func should return False to indicate that the row matches the search criteria.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_fixed_height_mode

listitem.simpara: True if fixed height mode is enabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_fixed_height_mode() method returns the value of the "fixed-height-mode" property. If the "fixed-height-mode" property is True, all rows are assumed to be the same height.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_fixed_height_mode

listitem.simpara: if True enable fixed height mode.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_fixed_height_mode() method sets the "fixed-height-mode" property to the value of enable. If enable is True all rows are assumed to have the same height which speeds up gtk.TreeView displays. Only enable this option if all rows are the same height and all columns are of type gtk.TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED (see the ).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_hover_selection

listitem.simpara: True if hover selection mode is enabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_hover_selection() method returns the value of the "hover-selection" property. If the "hover-selection" property is True the selected row follows the pointer. See the set_hover_selection() method for more detail.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_hover_selection

listitem.simpara: if True enable hover selection mode.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The () method sets the "hover-selection" property to the value of hover. If hover is True the hover selection mode is enables and the selected row follows the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes gtk.SELECTION_SINGLE and gtk.SELECTION_BROWSE (see the ).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_hover_expand

listitem.simpara: True if hover expand mode is enabled

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_hover_expand() method returns the value of the "hover-expand" property. If the "hover-expand" property is True rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_hover_expand

listitem.simpara: if True enable hover expand mode.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_hover_expand() method sets the "hover-expand" property to the value of expand. If expand is True, rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_row_separator_func

listitem.simpara: the row separator function or None
user data to pass to func, or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_row_separator_func() method sets the row separator function to the function specified by func. The row separator function is used to determine if a row should be displayed as a separator. If user_data is specified and not None, it is passed to func. If func is None, no separators will be drawn. The signature of func is:

where model is the gtk.TreeModel of the gtk.TreeView, iter is a gtk.TreeIter pointing to the current candidate row and data is the context data user_data. func should return True to indicate that the row is a separator.
A common way to implement this is to have a boolean column in model, whose values func returns.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_visible_range

listitem.simpara: a 2-tuple containing the start and end paths of the visible region or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_visible_range() method returns a 2-tuple containing the start and end paths for the visible region in the treeview. If no valid paths are available this method returns None.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_headers_clickable

listitem.simpara: True if all header columns are clickable

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns True if all header columns are clickable.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_search_entry

listitem.simpara: the entry currently in use as the search entry.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns the gtk.Entry which is currently in use as the interactive search entry for the treeview. In case the built-in entry is being used, None will be returned.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_search_entry

listitem.simpara: the entry the interactive search code of the treeview should use or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the entry which the interactive search code will use for this treeview. This is useful when you want to provide a search entry in our interface at all time at a fixed position. Passing None for entry will make the interactive search code use the built-in popup entry again.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_search_position_func

listitem.simpara: the function to use to position the search dialog, or None to use the default search position function
user data to pass to func, or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the function to use when positioning the search dialog. The signature of func is:
where search_dialog is the dialog to be positioned and user_data is data.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_rubber_banding

listitem.simpara: if True enable rubber banding

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Enables or disables rubber banding. If the selection mode is gtk.SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_rubber_banding

listitem.simpara: True if rubber banding is enabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns whether rubber banding is enabled. If the selection mode is gtk.SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_grid_lines

listitem.simpara: one of the indicating which grid lines are enabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns which grid lines are enabled.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_grid_lines

listitem.simpara: one of the indicating which grid lines to enable.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets which grid lines to draw.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_enable_tree_lines

listitem.simpara: True if tree lines are drawn.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns True if tree lines are drawn.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_enable_tree_lines

listitem.simpara: if True enable tree line drawing.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets whether to draw lines interconnecting the expanders. This does not have any visible effects for lists.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the widget.
Y coordinate relative to the widget.
A tuple containing the bin_window X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the bin_window (see get_bin_window).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_widget_to_tree_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the widget.
Y coordinate relative to the widget.
A tuple containing the tree X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_tree_to_widget_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the tree.
Y coordinate relative to the tree.
A tuple containing the widget X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to widget coordinates.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the tree.
Y coordinate relative to the tree.
A tuple containing the bin window X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to bin_window coordinates.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_bin_window_to_widget_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the bin window.
Y coordinate relative to the bin window.
A tuple containing the widget X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts bin window coordinates (see get_bin_window) to widget relative coordinates.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.convert_bin_window_to_tree_coords

listitem.simpara: X coordinate relative to the bin window.
Y coordinate relative to the bin window.
A tuple containing the tree X and Y coordinates.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Converts bin window coordinates (see get_bin_window) to the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_level_indentation

listitem.simpara: the amount of extra indentation for child levels in tree_view. A return value of 0 means that this feature is disabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation for child levels in tree_view.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_level_indentation

listitem.simpara: the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation in tree_view.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the amount of extra indentation for child levels to use in tree_view in addition to the default indentation. The value should be specified in pixels, a value of 0 disables this feature and in this case only the default indentation will be used. This does not have any visible effects for lists.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_show_expanders

listitem.simpara: True if expanders are drawn in tree_view, False otherwise.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns whether or not expanders are drawn in tree_view.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_show_expanders

listitem.simpara: True to enable expander drawing, False otherwise.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets whether to draw and enable expanders and indent child rows in tree_view. When disabled there will be no expanders visible in trees and there will be no way to expand and collapse rows by default. Also note that hiding the expanders will disable the default indentation. You can set a custom indentation in this case using gtk_tree_view_set_level_indentation(). This does not have any visible effects for lists.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.get_tooltip_column

listitem.simpara: the index of the tooltip column that is currently being used, or -1 if this is disabled.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns the column of tree_view's model which is being used for displaying tooltips on tree_view's rows.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_tooltip_column

listitem.simpara: an integer, which is a valid column number for tree_view's model

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: If you only plan to have simple (text-only) tooltips on full rows, you can use this function to have GtkTreeView handle these automatically for you. column should be set to the column in tree_view's model containing the tooltip texts, or -1 to disable this feature.
When enabled, GtkWidget::has-tooltip will be set to True and tree_view will connect a GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.is_rubber_banding_active

listitem.simpara: True if a rubber banding operation is currently being done in tree_view.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns whether a rubber banding operation is currently being done in tree_view.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_tooltip_cell

listitem.simpara: a gtk.Tooltip.
a tree path or None.
a gtk.TreeViewColumn or None.
a gtk.CellRenderer or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the tip area of tooltip to the area path, column and cell have in common. For example if path is None and column is set, the tip area will be set to the full area covered by column.

refsect2.title: gtk.TreeView.set_tooltip_row

listitem.simpara: a gtk.Tooltip.
a tree path.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the tip area of tooltip to be the area covered by the row at path.

refsect2.title: The "columns-changed" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "columns-changed" signal is emitted when a column has been added to, removed from or moved in treeview.

refsect2.title: The "cursor-changed" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "cursor-changed" signal is emitted when the cursor moves or is set.

refsect2.title: The "expand-collapse-cursor-row" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
if True
if True the row should be expanded
if True recursively expand all children
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "expand-collapse-cursor-row" signal is emitted when the row at the cursor needs to be expanded or collapsed.

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the movement step size
the number of steps to take
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "move-cursor" signal is emitted when the user moves the cursor using the Right, Left, Up or Down arrow keys or the Page Up, Page Down, Home and End keys.

refsect2.title: The "row-activated" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the path of the activated row
the column in the activated row
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "row-activated" signal is emitted when the row_activated() method is called or the user double clicks a treeview row. "row-activated" is also emitted when a non-editable row is selected and one of the keys: Space, ShiftSpace , Return or Enter is pressed.

refsect2.title: The "row-collapsed" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
a gtk.TreeIter pointing to the row that collapsed
the path of the row that collapsed
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "row-collapsed" signal is emitted when a row is collapsed by user of programmatic action.

refsect2.title: The "row-expanded" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
a gtk.TreeIter pointing to the row that expanded
the path of the row that expanded
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "row-expanded" signal is emitted when a row is expanded via user or programmatic action.

refsect2.title: The "select-all" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "select-all" signal is emitted when the user presses Controla or Control/ .

refsect2.title: The "select-cursor-parent" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "select-cursor-parent" signal is emitted when the user presses Backspace while a row has the cursor.

refsect2.title: The "select-cursor-row" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
if True the cell editing is started
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "select-cursor-row" signal is emitted when a non-editable row is selected and one of the keys: Space, ShiftSpace, Return or Enter is pressed.

refsect2.title: The "set-scroll-adjustments" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
a horizontal gtk.Adjustment
a vertical gtk.Adjustment
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "set-scroll-adjustments" signal is emitted when new horizontal or vertical adjustments are set on the treeview.

refsect2.title: The "start-interactive-search" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "start-interactive-search" signal is emitted when the user presses Controlf .

refsect2.title: The "test-collapse-row" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the gtk.TreeIter pointing at the row to test.
the path of the row to be tested
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the row should be collapsed.

refsect2.para: The "test-collapse-row" signal is emitted when the row pointed to by iter and path is to be collapsed.

refsect2.title: The "test-expand-row" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the gtk.TreeIter pointing at the row to test.
the path of the row to test
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the row should be expanded.

refsect2.para: The "test-expand-row" signal is emitted when the row pointed to by iter and path is to be expanded.

refsect2.title: The "toggle-cursor-row" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "toggle-cursor-row" signal is emitted when the user presses ControlSpace .

refsect2.title: The "unselect-all" gtk.TreeView Signal

listitem.simpara: the treeview that received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the signal was handled.

refsect2.para: The "unselect-all" signal is emitted when the user presses ShiftControla or ShiftControl/ .
